comments.body: Or a hoe?
Love this
Sugar part already exsists, just put a honey bottle in the crafting grid and you'll get 3 sugar
I agree. I also think that splash or lingering potions should affect them (If Levitation Potions ever get made) so then people on Survival can use them too.
This would be great for making an elevator, by effecting the player at the same time!
Good idea!
Endermen hate carved pumpkins already, no? But interesting idea.
This is basicly an adventure map
No!  no planes, boats, or money.  Minecraft is a midevil game.
I feel like this idea doesn't really fit into Minecraft. It just doesn't seem like something the developers would actually add.
It would be able to only need one player and could be a map in the store
This this is a very cute idea, but I think it should be one hit.
Hi developer of Mojang.

Gostaria de ter a possibilidade de criar entidades sólidas com a implantação de um novo comando. Assim teríamos mais condições para a criação de addons melhores e mais interativos como os de embarcações.
Like the idea

Too cheap? you mean to say that killing enderdragon is an easy task? and anyways if you really are going against a no armor opponent killing him should happen regardless, it's like endercrystals, they are ridiculously op, just use them, they are also really cheap with the right setups.
If It Happens We can have a underwater pvp
I totaly agree.

This feels tedious and unfun and I feel it would kill a lot of the enjoyment the update aquatic (1.13) brought to the game. Additionally it would require a re-balancing of aquatic PVE in order to make underwater PVE possible at all.
It would be enough just to slow the animations down and add a bubbly underwater whooshing sound.
Maybe making that this doesn't affect the trident, making it more unique and useful

If illagers were weak to jade instead of diamond, that could add a new weapon to the game that doesn't exactly have to be a sword. It could be a special jade dagger or katana, adding a cool new weapon to the game, specific to the mob type. That would make jade the key to being able to more effectively storm the woodland mansion and the illager posts. Plus it could make raids go by faster.

What about a jade dragon? The illagers have imprisoned it somewhere deep in the bowels of the Minecraft world, faaaar from spawn, and held down by ropes and chains. You'd be able to realize you were nearing one when you see patrols and guard towers spawn closer together. Freeing the dragon would make the dragon your ally. With it, the dragon would be able to be seen flying around the world, sometimes returning to its nest which could be found in the mountains. You would have to follow it to get to its stash of jade artifacts and sleep curled up next to it for a good omen status effect to improve your enchanting.

Maybe the jade dragon is the mate of the red dragon but the jade dragon was taken away from their love by the illagers and it's the player's job to get them back together again and end the reign of the illagers over Minecraft. Possibly turning the illagers into wandering villagers that you can bring back to villages or create your own for them. This would make you an actual HERO in Minecraft and would be a lot of fun to play out as an adventure with your friends. This could be a quest that not only is quite cute in the idea of the soulmates, but adds lore, adds gameplay, and adds other features that we've been wanting for a while.
This idea sounds really cool! I'd love to see this new ore in the game
They have this on realms
You make this sound like hate mail. I don’t think Minecraft will go obsolete that quickly...

For me, I was bringing one of my animals into my underground base via water, and after 10 seconds or so, I got them to the bottom while attached to a lead. As that happened, it started to drown, and I couldn't get them out in time. I have not played much of that world, and Minecraft in general since because of this, and really hope that the ability to go back on save files will exist sometime soon.
"Lumber enchantment" is really similar to this and has been suggested, has 300+ votes.

I had this idea too and found your post so voted for it, think it would add a lot to the exploration aspect. One suggestion would be to make it dependent on movement, if you sneak it wouldn't activate and also the activation could be delayed a little to allow the player to move further over the blocks before activation, maybe only blocks that are surrounded on all sides by only air, sand and gravel could activate (so you would have to be at least two blocks in for it to activate). and with tricks to lay sand and gravel without support an easy trap could be made.
I agree with your Idea very well. Plz check out my ideas

It would be a good idea but by making sand, gravel, and other falling blocks experience a block update when walking across them would mean that observers could get a signal from this meaning very annoying traps and if every block that you walk on in a desert causes a block update that may cause some issues with frame rate but I'm not sure how block updates affect fps.

this could also be used to make crazy player detectors too, where like an extended piston could be pulled when you stand on it, which would appeal to the technical community, new structures could be found by walking over intentional sinkholes forcing you to explore them, appealing to the adventurous community, if there was a way to intentionally suspend the falling block, it could also appeal to the pvp community by allowing more various and unique traps to be made. it could also appeal to the map-making community by adding a feature that can lead to interesting parkour courses or challenges to overcome where say you have to be careful not to touch the ground but it gives you a chance to get back up the first time. the only real issue that I see with this would be that often in deserts caves can run just under the first layer of the ground, which could ruin the look of the desert and completely destroy weak computers or old phones, so if this was to be added, it would need to be accompanied with generation changes to make it more feasible to run
No
No
It could be an achievement But they already have an achievement. For going Into one :achievement the end?
This has no place in Minecraft.
I kinda want to be able to be more responsible in Minecraft but the thing is. Cutting off trees would still leave a blue sky, since we're not polluting, same with the pieces of trash in the ocean.
Only reason is you are BRITISH im Amarican do so ya boiiiiiiii

Cutting down trees actually does make the air dirty. Humans have been releasing greenhouse gases such as methane (CH4) and carbon dioxide (CO2). The trees usually take in the carbon dioxide and turn it to oxygen (O2) but there is too much. This not only leads to bad air quality but also global warming. So he is right about the tree thing.
It would raise a lot of awareness so I think this should be added. You won my vote.
what about the bedrock though?

Good point... maybe for if you're in creative and are trying to get to the end that's just an alternate route. Or maybe there is just some spots on the bottom layer with fake bedrock. except it takes 30-45 seconds to mine with a diamond pickaxe!
This is a good idea but, what if it causes the ender dragon (if not dead) to go THROUGH the hole and into the overworld?

If you are trying to do this, if it is added to the game, an ender dragon 1. Cannot break obsidian, and 2. DEFIANTLY cannot break bedrock that is harder than obsidian. Also, it would not be able to go through a hole unless it was about 7 or so blocks wide. No one would even want to make a hole like that, because it would take such a toll on tools.
Great idea! But why to the end? Why not the the nether? I think it would make more sense if after falling through the void you can get above nether bedrock
I have made a datapack that does just this, letting you fly back and forth from each dimension.
Make a lava pit at the surface
I 110% agree with this. It's useless to have so many saddles. What the heck are we supposed to do with them? Over run our world with livestock and hope we don't lag out before we use them all?
I wonder how this isn't in the game already. It seems like such a small but useful addition and hopefully this can be added. It already works with creepers as an easter egg, but other mobs?
It works with creepers by blowing them up, not setting them on fire. Other mobs would just be set on fire. It wouldn't make sense for other mobs to explode with a flint and steel.
I think this would be too op :p
Personally, I don't think it's op. Fire aspect is way more overpowered than this, and so if fire aspect exists, then I think this should too.

Moved to proper category.

Thanks for your contribution.
why not just allow /tickingarea command in the survival mode?
Just enable the /tickingarea command without cheats.
Perhaps these stat boost would be affected by potions, thus making potion brewing more worthwhile as well.

Cool bro!

Nice idea on grouping the food types.

Food effects and the combination of those effects would motivate players to eat others stuff not like ONLY GOLDEN CARROTS (eat you salad kids), but also to motivate even more, would be interesting to make a specific type of food less effective if is the only thing the players has been eating for a while.

The honey (introduced in snapshot 19w34a) fills a player saturation, a step on the right direction.

Cake, a non stackable food should also give a really good effect to motivate.

Regarding the effects during a MC day, not feeling that. How about the introduction of a threshold, the same way when you only have 3 food icons left you cant sprint any more. If not a player could keep jumping to eat lots of food to stack on effects. I don't know really, kinda lost my train of though in this last one. But regardless hope to see this idea on the game.

I think the basic premise of diversified nutrition is great, but I think the way it should work is, if you eat too much of one type of food, it begins to have less effect on your hunger. e.g. If all you eat is steak, eventually it will only restore half a shank. To counteract this, you'd have to eat a variety of food. 

Say, five different variants of food before steak starts to work properly again
Great ideas in comments! Appreciate that. Food should play more complex role, definately
Wow I had an idea almost exactly like this and posted it a few hours ago hahahaha
I like this idea, but I was thinking of something more of where if you die, you keep the spell, but you won't be able to use it until you reach that level you got the spell again.
